With school starting up in a couple days, I had to find a way to exercise my brain, and what better way to do that than to pick out the flaws in the plots of TV shows and movies. First I was thinking about "Small Soldiers" for some reason. Then it hit me. You know how they inserted those military chips into the toys. Where would they get millions of military chips. And those chips cost a lot of money, wouldn't they go bankrupt selling $20 toys with million-dollar chips in them? Then I started watching "Malcolm in the Middle", the one on Sunday, You know when all the different groups started fighting because of the Krelborns? Well, I thought "There's got to be sth wrong with this" Then I thought about it and looked at the diff groups, there were the jocks, goths, skaters, and the posers, and then I was like, "Wtf, there's no group of posers, that's why they're called posers, cuz they act like people in other groups." That's all for now, I'll probably add to this later...

In Model U.N. monday, they had a speech contest. We had to give an effective 30 second speech about Global Warming using only words that began with "I" or "T"...and they all have to be real words and make sense. I think that this industrial toxin, that illuminates the troposphere, is insufficient to invent treaties. The temperature takes time to increase, therefore I think that immeadiate involvement isn't tenable. The task is tremendous, to tell industrial territories to trim their industrialism. The imperious territories that insist that the treaty is imperative, impede the tiny territories' trails to increase their thrift. This treaty therefore then increases the tiny territories's instability.

Contrary to comments made in Alex's speech in Model U.N. in which he stated that everybody had nuclear weapons, and the US should not pick on Iraq, I am going to state that not everybody has nuclear weapons. The country I'm representing, for example, Laos, does not possess any nuclear weapons. Lao's navy also consist of only one merchant ship but that besides the point. In addition, Laos has a miniscule GDP of only 9.2 billion dollars compared to that of the US ($10.082 trillion). Lao's per capita is $1,630, while the US's is $36,300. And yet Laos is the third largest illicit opium producer, producing an estimated 200 metric tons in 2001 with 22,000 hectares of cultivation. According to the CIA, Laos is also a "potential heroin producer; transshipment point for heroin and methamphetamine produced in Burma; illicit producer of cannabis; growing methamphetamine abuse problem". The exports of Laos include sweet potatoes, vegetables, coffee, sugarcane, tobacco, cotton; tea, peanuts, rice; water buffalo, pigs, cattle, poultry, and corn, or as the Indians called it, maize. Another famous Indian was Crazy Horse. In conclusion, Laos is a land of contrast.

We had a math meet this Wednesday at Newton South. I, myself, didn't do very well, but it was really fun. A-team came in 4th and B-team came in 7th of 12. I only got one measly point on B-team. Brian got F&*%ing 13. North A beat South A, and North B beat South B, so thats all that matters. There were a lot of laughs at the meet. First, I didn't realize it, but for some reason I had brought my ping-pong paddle with me to school that day. Next, because there were no upperclassmen on B-team, all of us had to do really hard rounds. My rounds were fractions and related word problems, Polygons and Areas involving them, and advanced trigonometry. Then, on the team round it was really funny. The team round is three questions that are harder than the ones on the regular rounds, and you can work as a team. I forgot to put down my paddle, and accidently brought it into the testing room. Then we got started. When we got our tests, we really didn't have any idea what to do with the problems so we started like yelling at each other because they weren't doing it right. Note that we were in the same room as three other teams, including North A. They just kind of stared at us then went back to their tests. We finally managed to scrape out an answer for one of the problems with about 30 seconds left. At the 15-second call, we panicked because we didn't have anything worked out for the next two problems. So we were like, "OMG, just put a random number! Put 6! put 6!". The groups around us were all whispering to each other, "don't believe them, it's not 6". We wrote it down right when our tests were collected. We went outside and waited for the answers to be posted. Guess what the answer was. 6! We got 6 points for team round and had the second highest score for that round, higher than North A, and higher than Boston Latin, Newton South. Praise the Paddle! Ahhh... Good times

I getting this strange new liking for Emo music, until like a few months ago i didnt even know what it was, commonly mistaking it for other genres... I need to find the actual almost definition for Emo, google should do the trick. That strange new icon is really weird Ah this should do the trick, a site titled "What the heck is Emo anyways" "This site is intended to be a basic FAQ and primer on emo - short for "emotional." Emo is a broad title that covers a lot of different styles of emotionally-charged punk rock." That's interesting... Let's read on... "Lyrics tend toward somewhat abstract poetry, and are usually low in the mix and hard to decipher. Record inserts have lyrics, but often so disorganized and haphazard that they're very difficult to read [unless the record was released on Ebullition Records, in which case there are many inserts on small, brightly-colored papers containing poetic writing from the label owner and all his friends about disillusionment, anger, and things that happened when the writer was four. Such writing is known as emo writing, and there are many, many zines just like that]. Said inserts are almost always done with antique typewriters or miniscule hand-lettering, containing no punctuation or capitalization. Often the only information about the band listed is the band members' first names. Another trait of really emo records is to have no information whatsoever about song titles." Some emo bands that are actually good: Taking Back Sunday, New Found Glory, Jimmy Eat World, etc... Commonly mistaken for punk rock, alt rock, stuff like that, actually a branch of those, xcept with more emotion, compare a Taking Back Sunday song to a Blink 182 song, there is a difference, noticeably.... AAAH what am i talking about Now i see again why no one ever visits this thing

Oh oh oh, I just remembered, apparently Hiro wrote about me in his application for Stanford, it was really quite strange. He talked about after Olympiad when he was still trying to do a problem, and he was trying to use like integrals and stuff, but then I told him that he could just unroll the cylinder and it becomes a rectangle... Good Stuff... The question was something like, well I am substituting different numbers in: "A right cylinder has a diameter of [4/pi] and a height of [15]. A spiral is drawn from the bottom to the top of the cylinder, making exactly two complete revolutions around the cylinder. What is the length of the spiral?" So if you follow, Hiro was trying to use like unnecessarily hard things to solve the problem like calculus and stuff. But really you juat have to unroll the cylinder and then it becomes a rectangle with the spiral being the diagonal of the rectangle, and then you just Pythagorize it. So that was pretty cool, and then Anne was like, "Now, Loren, when you apply for Stanford, you can be like 'I am the notorious Loren that Hiroaki Tanaka wrote about in his application.'" Blogity blogity blog... I don't really have anything to write...But I am mega bored... It is really hard to buy clothes for me... Oh yeah side-note, today I went out to buy myself I new Ping Pong paddle, but I couldn't find any, so instead I bought I think 3 new sweaters, new shoes, a new frisbee, a ski hat, and like winter glove-y type things... I need to cut down on my implusive spending... Anyways back to it being hard to buy clothes for me... No sweaters like fit me right it so weird, either like the shoulders are way too broad or the sleeves are mega long, or something... I need a new ping pong paddle... But now I'm short on the cash... Today I must have spent what like at least 150 dollars... Oh well... Anyways... I think it's gonna be our half coming up this friday, pretty exciting... Too bad I blew all my money... Actually I still have 50 dollars to spend... This is how much money you get if you ask for lunch money every week and don't actually use it... New idea: Let's calculate how much money you can save by not buying lunch... Let's say the average person spends 20 dollars a week on school food stuffs, that's like a meal and a drink every day. 4 dollars a day for 180 days... that is... 720 dollars per school year... Ok. so for a person like me, I might spend 5 dollars a week, or like 1 dollar per day on average. So I save 3 dollars per day [disregarding the fact that I starve]. So that comes out to like 3 dollars a day for 180 days, so like 540 dollars saved... Loren is loaded... I doubt this plan will actually work though with my huge spending sprees... Anyways, yesterday at John's house, the following conversation took place: Me: "Kevin, you do realize that those were down my pants..." Kevin: "W/e I'm eating them anyways"

So Saturday I slept over Josh's at Philip's Academy. I got there at 7 or so and then josh, Lynette, and I debated about what to do for aout an hour. Josh wanted to get a pizza and Lynette wanted to go to the cemetery, oo spooky... Anyways, we ended up buying a pizza and eating it in the cemetery, which wasn't a very good idea. Josh was sitting on someone's tombstone while holding the pizza box, and then dropped the pizza, on some dead body. Harriet Beecher Stowe is buried in that cemetery... She might wake up and go all "Uncle Tom's Cabin" on us... So then we walked around for another 3 hours going back and forth between Lynette's dorm, Josh's dorm, and other places, and then finally at like 11:30 me and Josh went back to his dorm. I met Brian again, and his roommate, Andrew, who is outrageously smart, and other ppl like Vincent, Owen, Aaron, Geoff, etc. In the morning I had to go to NH, so I had to leave at like early morning, but it was really fun. Oh yeah today I see the Red Sox play oooooo, what now.... Lynette/Josh I will visit again someday...

On saturday me, sam, Josh magid, Noah Jampol, Jake G-A, Andrew habermehl, and Phil keefe all played football at Day it was so much fun. They insisted on playing tackle, which if you think of Me, sam, G-A, and Noah tackling each other, was pretty amusing. The first play of the game I had the hugest hit on sam it was soo funny and we were both like on the ground for a while. So basically sam, knowing it was me that was charging him, thought he could just like bowl me over, but apparently he couldn't and and so we like smacked into each other and sam like flew backwards, and everybody else started cracking up so badly. I had some more unexpected hits on G-A and Jampol, but none as exciting as the first one. Also G-A kept running out-of-bounds so he wouldn't get tackled, which was pretty funny also, but kind of annoying. On Sunday I had chinese school which was quite boring, and no one really cares... I would put funnier stuff in here, but all the semi-funny stuff goes in my sub Profile so look there... But I will leave you with these things Joe said, as he was trying to recruit people for science team: "Join Science team because we're not as nerdy as we look!" "Join Science team to show off how much you know... or don't know..." "Join Science team so you can get into pretty much any college you want... not really though..." And finally my quote to Calvin: "Women, can't live with them, can't go 2 milli-seconds without thinking of your sister..."

Well that cow was pretty uneventful... Let's recap: Wednesday: Jason, Yilun, Jean, and Melody came over. Between my window pointing and dying-ness it was pretty fun. I won't elaborate because I am lazy. So basically unless you are Jason, Yilun, Jean, and/or Melody, yes a combination works too, you probably won't get what I mean. Thursday: NH, met up with the Wheelers, they are pretty cool people. Half and Half. Weird. Of course none of you know who they are. Austin and Charles Wheeler. Oh yeah that girl Juliana was there too. They are all Ivy-League ppl, aah. Jason: So how was Gaymont? Me: You mean Gay Hampshire? Friday: Went to one of my parents crazy drinking parties. The 18 year old 8th grader was there. My mom was complaining that the drinks were too light. Guo Hanbing came with us. Her family is a bit too uptight for their parties. Saturday: Chinese School Thanksgiving party. Ehh... Boring-ness. I need to find some like real parties to go to. Sunday: Sat around, watched the Pats game, football is stupid. I am kind of tired from staying out past midnight for three days straight... But I am going to elaborate on my wednesday experience anyway. Anyway, Jason and I went to Starbucks for lunch, Jean and Melody apparently were hungry for the pizza-type food, ugh. Somehow, although we got the same thing at the same time, my order came in 15 minutes after Jason's. And then I saw Melody and Jean in the reflection in the window and pointed at them, not realizing that Jason wouldn't be able to see them. So he was wondering what I was pointing at, and I was like "Look look they're coming." And he was confused, untl they got close enough that we could see them without looking in the reflection. And then we went to my house, played some PtR and Tekken 3, two of the best games ever made, and then decided to go to Franklin. We played that slappy game, and I broke the blood vessels in my hand. That was the first time I've gotten broken blood vessels by anything other than... umm yeah. Anyway... We then played this stupid game that Jean wanted to play called, "Two ppl swing while two other people run under them trying not to get kicked in the face" and then we played "See who can launch themselves off the swings the farthest" I neglected to acknowledge that I had never tried jumping out of a swing before and therefore did not know how, so I killed myself on the landing, or lack thereof. I won though. So then we went back to my house and... did...stuff... Jean looked kind of left out, though one could argue that he was just as involved as I was, :P. Jean was acting pretty gay though. Not that there's anything wrong with that of course... I just don't enjoy having my balls groped by Jean as much as it might seem.
Lily is such a beach. Thanxgiving is almost here... woohoo... Let's all give thanks for stuff. We have to have those stilt wars Sam.

There are a bunch of things I could be talking about... Topic #1: Re:Sally Sally has become increasingly forward, it is frightening, and also pretty annoying. Jason, Jean, and I were in the weight room, and Sally popped in and insisted that I watch the football game with her. When I refused, she like grabbed me by the shirt and dragged my out of the weight room. In response to my many escape attempts she said the following memorable quote: "Come or I will rip your shirt off!" She did actually rip my shirt a little. Melody said, "You should have ripped her shirt back, then she would have to walk around half naked." I didn't know how to respond. And then I escaped when she asked me to go into the locker room to see who was in there, and then I just went back to the weight room from there. But when I got back to the weight room, Jason had apparently gone looking for me. So I had to go back upstairs and get recaptured. But then she let me go again to go talk to Pat Pierce, who she had tried to run with earlier that day. Haha, Sally running with Pat Pierce... Topic #2: Re: The Locker Room Incident So Jason and I went into the locker room on friday and Polgar was there, and he started telling us how Eric Dooley and this other kid turned off the lights, started singing the Mortal Kombat theme, and then "exposed themselves" and started running around the locker room terrorizing people. And then maybe like a minute after Polgar finishes his story, Dooley and that other kid walk in, and Jason says, "We heard what you did" and Dooley just laughs. Then the other kid turns off the lights and they start singing the Mortal Kombat theme and running around. Except this time, Polgar took out a flashlight and shined it on a certain part of Dooley's body. Now Jason and I are scarred for life. We did get a couple laughs out of it however, later on. Jason: "Eric Dooley's 'member' is a Nazi." And by that I mean a skinhead. Me: Haha, he seems to be quite deficient in some areas. Jason: Hahaha, hairless half-incher. Topic #3: I guess there weren't that many topics after all... The End. [edit] Oh yeah now I remember one more ok. Topic #3: Business Law On Friday I was so bored during Business Law that I was falling asleep, and we took a test midway through the period. And so, I was taking the test and I fell asleep while taking it, and apparently I fell asleep while writing something because I was in the middle of the word, and then after that there were like scribbles on my paper. That was pretty weird. Topic #4: Computers Matt Woolf and I are so ahead of our Computers class, that our teacher asked us to make up our own project and then do it, and then have it be the next assignment for the class. So we decided to make a square root reducer, which is pretty simple, if you know what you are doing. That was fun. Extra credit. Ok really the end now.

I have realized that, for you to see my chinese blogging, you would not only need to change the encoding, you also need to allow your computer to view East Asian Languages. To do so: 1. Go to the Control Panel 2. Click on the Languages Tab 3. Check the box that says "Allow for East Asian Languages" or what not. It has been said that this requires the Windows CD to do, but I don't think that that is true. But if you do whatever. So anyways today we raided John Garabedian's house, I was still a bit pained from my workout, but the others basically ate everything single ounce of food in his house, including all his english muffins and all his cough drops. And all his single serving Tylenol packets. Not really though. It has been said that my blog is lacking substance. I need to change this song... It's so terrible. Especially in midi form. So my Christmas. Rocelyn came over, she's my Filipina aunt. She's pretty cool. Wait did I spell her name right? Uhh... I think so... w/e. Anyway, we opened presents and my mom got me like a DDR set thingy, except she won't let me open it cuz Kevin got me the same thing and she wants me to get the receipt from him. So now I have 2 DDR things, and I can't play either. Ros mentioned how I looked so anxious and that I just wanted to like rip the box open. She compared me to "A starving man who can see food right in front of him but can't eat it." She's pretty cool. I already said that. Well then I opened other presents. And I got a bunch of CD's by HK people. Which is so weird, cuz I only listen to Taiwanese singers, but because of recent events I have realized that they would never buy me a Taiwanese CD. So they got me a Andy Lau CD. weird. I am never going to listen to it. Sorry but i have to say that Taiwanese people are annoying. Not because of class differentials or anything. But like, they're part of China, and then they are all like "Screw you guys, we're becoming independent" and then we're like "Hey, we're all Chinese, can't we all be friends?" and then they're like, "No, screw you guys." And so now they're independent, and they try to make us look like the bad guys, by saying that we want to bomb them, which is completely untrue. And now the President of Taiwan is like "Just to make our relationship with Mainland China worse, I'm going to say that Taiwan never should have been part of China, but really should be included in the Japanese archipelago." I mean shuuutttt uuupppp. Just cuz you are half Japanese yourself doesn't mean you have to take your whole "independent state" with you. I mean you all speak Mandarin, however bad your accent might be, and you are mostly all Chinese by blood, other than the aboriginals, because most of you migrated from Mainland China. So while I don't have that much of a problem with Taiwan being independent, I hate how they are like "Nananana, we're not part of China, screw you guys." Ok, enough ranting, back to Christmas. Hmm...what else happened, oh yeah on Christmas Eve, we had our Christmas Pageant. Andrew Habermehl was Joseph and Willa K-H was Mary. Anne: "Won't you guys have a pretty chubby Mary?" Me: "Well she is supposed to be 9 months pregnant in the beginning." Anywho, the lady running it was retarded, for lack of a more pc term. Stephanie Kaplan: "I hate it when people get mad when you say retarded. I mean it's obviously a bad thing so shut up already" But she really didn't know what she was doing. She sent people up at the wrong times, told them to do the wrong things, and overall made it quite disatrous. Andrew (to Eric): "Who are you supposed to be?" Eric Beam: "I'm the Shepherd's Joy. Well, I'm a shepherd, but specifically I'm his joy." Andrew: "Hahaha" Eric: "I AM JOY" For anyone who didn't understand that, there was this part of the pageant called "The Shepherd's Joy" where one shepherd (Eric Beam) goes up and reads a monologue about how he is so happy about like being able to see Jesus and all. I saw "The Last Samurai" the other day, it was a pretty good movie. I have to watch LOTR:ROTK soon. I still want to just rip that DDR box thing open, but I can't... Am I going to make this longer and even more excruciatingly painful to read? I could but I don't think I'm going to. I still need to get new musak.
Newer Song: "Wei Lan Gu Bao (William's Castle) ~Jay Chou

So I was staring at this like picture-thingy cuz it is my new found hobby, and I am constantly so utterly bored. And so, I was looking at us. And of course Melody looks absolutely perfect as always. She's holding a water bottle, and the top of it like just sticks into the picture. Because of the perspective, I can't tell if she's leaning forward or leaning towards me, or a combination of the two. So then I switched to looking at me, because apparently I am vain. In the picture, my teeth seem like 4 shades whiter. And my eyebrows are actually normal... I remember those days. My hair is screwed up in that picture, or possibly, it justs seems that way cuz I am standing in front of like this strange thing. My arm is bent funnily. It looks weird. Anywho, if it were yesterday, I would start griping again about how amazing of a present this is, and how I felt bad cuz my present sucked. But today is not yesterday, so I won't go into that. Song: "Runaway" ~ David Tao

Doo doo doo. It's vacation. Wooohooo... If you couldn't tell, that was supposed to be sarcastic. I'm never very enthuiastic about these things. Eh.... I am inordinately grumpy today, and then I'm mean to people. And I know I'm being mean to them too, but I don't care. This is weird and like un-me. I'm supposed to be like Loren, perfectly complacent and like Lorenesque, for lack of a better term. Melody gave me a picture of us in like a luvvy-duvvy picture frame. I keep looking at it. It's so nice. It was such a thoughtful present. The frame is glass, and my desk is glass so it is cool in that way too. My presents for people were so terrible. I am such a bad Christmas shopper. ughhhhhhhhh... I hate it when people complain like this on their xangas/blogs/livejournals. I swore that I would never ever do it. I don't even know why I am. Talking to Anne just generally makes me angry. I mean, she's great to be with in person but online she just won't stop complaining... Ugh, and it's always like "my mom this, my mom that." I like Anne's mom. She gave me a Christmas present, and Anne didn't. I also gave Anne's mom a Christmas present but not Anne. Conflict of Interests. Anywho, apparently since she doesn't have AIM anymore, again I'm the only one she can bitch to. And while I won't say anything to her, I just want to be like "Shut up..." I also realized that for some reason if the picture falls down/gets pushed down, not only will the frame break, but my desk will break also. Oh well, let's hope that doesn't happen. I can't how like nice this is. And it's all like "Love is magical and eternal, Love is selfless, Joy, Passion, etc." Why can't I get people presents like this? Get over it, Loren. Nobody wants to hear you complain, especially not about your completely lame presents. Ok.

So today in French, we were watching "Au Revoir Les Enfants" and Jean Bonnet/Kippelstein was reading 1001 Arabian Nights with Julian. And so they start reading this story in which there is this naked girl. And so the narrator describes her in terms of different races/nationalities, I can't remember them because frankly I wasn't paying much attention to the erotic-ness. But then the last line in the description caught my eye; it was "She had the narrow passage of a Chinese girl" and I started cracking up. Other people didn't find it quite as funny. Then I stopped laughing because I realized that it would be a long, long, long time before I got to enter any narrow Chinese passages.

Today was amazingly awesome. It like doesn't even deserve to be counted as a day. Let's Recap: A-Block: We had a sub for English. Supposedly we were doing our homework in class, but around my area, very few people were actually doing it. Ian's brought in some very good brownies, and basically the whole period we played with my frozen Sierra Mist. B-Block: I had a free block because my teacher was out. That was fun. I just sat outside that Latin room doing my homework the whole period. C-Block: Another free because Belmarsh was out. Ian' tried to drag me into his History class, but in the end I just hung out in the cafeteria with Jonk and Kevin. E-Block: Our history class was in the library, "researching". It was pretty unproductive I thought, since we weren't allowed to take out the books we found on our topics. G-Block: All we did in math was this weird graphing exercise the whole class, it was pretty boring. And stupid and pointless. As is everything we do in Math. F-Block: Mlle. Mazor is back from her malade. We spent most of the class going over the hw and playing this fun game where Sam and I made great sentences together. Overall, very fun.

Hmmm... I don't believe that Yin can be drill instructer like, it's just so un-Yin, I mean I know he's driven, but he's always seemed like the apathetic type of guy.

It's been pretty uneventful lately, but I'm bored so I blog. Because of New Year's, 4 of the last five days, not including today, have been spent at my parents' drunken parties. They actually been pretty fun, even though I was like the only sober one there. Chinese people show that they are drunk in their faces, but they don't act like they're drunk very much. Then again, I don't really know how people act when they are drunk. Jay Chou performed this song in the New Year's Festival, if anyone watched that, I don't know why you would. He's such a bad live performer. Oh well. Oh oh revelation. Oliver can be like Young Lu, that loser. I actually think I might be able to beat him up, despite my lack of the ability to throw a punch. I think you need like your arms to be able to function to do that. I can actually bench more than my weight now on the Nautilus, I'm proud of myself. Then again, being able to bench more than I weigh isn't really saying much. Yup. My father is watching that New Year's Festival thingy over and over again, he taped it. It's pretty exciting.

Oh yeah I just remembered another Kalow-ism. OK yesterday in Chem, we were doing the Periodicity Lab, and Mr. Belmarsh gave a a relatively large piece of sodium to react. And so we were supposed to take the submerged test tube out of the water without letting the gas escape, except Jonny couldn't get his finger over the hole, so he ended up with his hand in the Sodium hydroxide solution for like 30 seconds while not realizing what it was, and he was like: "Why is this burning my hand so much?!" Today he complained that a layer of his skin had ben taken off.

Haha, I just had one of those times when I think of random things and then I crack up. This time I thought back to that time after Model U.N. when I was talking to Joey Backer and Ben Fong and they were telling me this story about Ben and John Garabedian. So apparently in the winter Ben Fong sees John Garabedian while walking to school and he likes to push him in the snow. So one day Ben sees John Garabedian walking to school and he decides to push him as usual. But then John like falls into the street, and so Ben feels bad and decides to help him up. But then, here's the best part, when Ben helps him up, he sees that it isn't John at all, but some like old man. Haha, I was laughing my face off. And now Ben Fong is scared to go near anyone for fear of injuring senior citizens. I thought it was pretty funny. You'd probably have to be there though. Or have Ben Fong tell the story.
I just realized this, look how many times I say "That was fun" in my last last post. It's like every other line. I must have had a lot of fun that day.

I was "master of ceremonies" emcee-ing for the Chinese New Year Festival thing at that Chink School of mine. I think it went wonderfully well. Afterwards, I went to the "dance" with Kevin, Brian, Larry, and the Jing gang. It wasn't as much of a dance as a "sit-around-and-talk-while-older-people-dance-to-ballroom-music." But it was pretty fun. So... them Patriots are going to the Superbowl, eh? Great excuse to watch those awesome commercials they have. "An Jing" ~Jay Chou. I like it. Except that it's like the ultimate "take me back" song, and I don't know who I would be asking to take me back. Actually it's less of a "take me back" song than a "She left me and I'm going to have to get over it" song. Cuz he realizes that she won't. Take him back, that is. Oh yeah, one more thing, I am funny and cool in Stephanie Kaplan's book. This excites me. I probably shouldn't keep saying that or else as I said to Alex, "I will cease to be funny or cool."

So Wednesday was a half-day. Woohoo. I did so many stupid things that day and I am back to my losing ways. I was playing volleyball, and apparently I got hit in the face, although I don't remember it happening, and it knocked the lens out of my glasses and I didn't realize it until like I was changing back into my normal clothes and when I took my glasses off, my finger went through the hole where the lens goes. I was pretty surprised. And then I had French. Jacob Fleming made me transfer my calculator games to him and afterward I put the calculator in my desk. But after french I forgot to take it back, and the next period I had a math test, and one of the questions was like, "Use the calc function on your calculator..." and I was like "Uh oh." That was fun. Math sux. And then after math I went out in search of some people, and then I saw Emily Price, and she was like "If you're waiting for Melody, she already left." And so, I was so disappointed because my entire purpose in life for that day was finding her, and I didn't so I was like, "Why do these things keep happening to me?" So then I found George, and we were both looking for ways to get home, and so we decided to combine our efforts. He started asking all his Russian friends and they all refused to give him a ride. Somehow Nichole Seto knows who I am, that's so weird. George asked her for a ride and she was like "Why don't you ask Loren?" And I was surprised. Kevin, Nichole Seto is the short one that likes Nong. Then George and I decided to go to KFC. We found the gang there, and I ditched George for them. Then we went to John's house and we well funned ourselves. I left my backpack at KFC, which was annoying. Ok so yesterday, it was pretty exciting. It was supposed to be D-day, so just to make Alex happy, I said that I had rushed back from Computers to see how it went when really I just went to see Melody in all her splendor. Ahhh... Good Splendor. Then I went to lunch. I paid 50 cents for Hiro to say stuff to Julia Kalow, but it didn't really work. He was supposed to to say: "Hey, Julia, do you know if Jonny likes anyone? ...Do you know if he's free this Saturday?" But then it backfired when after the first question, Julia said, "JONNY DOESN'T HAVE HORMONES!" That was fun. So then after school, I went to chess club with "who-else" and then i went to the club to pseudo-work. It was pretty fun because I had to staff over Bradley and Nick Lombardi and I could like tell them what to do. **Control freak** W/e that was fun. Oh yeah one more thing. Alex was listening to "Hey Ya" and he got annoyed when they said "fo sho" instead of "for sure" and then in History, they were talking about this place called "Fashoda" and I wanted to say to him, "Shouldn't it be 'For-sure-da?'" And we both said that at like the same time. I think he has made it "For-Sure-The" now, but it was pretty funny. Yeah... That was fun.

That's the bad thing about mp3's, since they are so much bigger than midi's, if you don't have a good connection, they'll just like stop in the middle of the song and then you get annoyed. Well, maybe it is a good thing that it is stopping idk, w/e you want.

The other day I went to Boston with Alex, John, and Jon. It was moderately fun. We watched Paycheck, and then I ate a Mandarino Gelatto. It tasted pretty good, but I only bought it because it was "mandarino" flavored. Oh I also ate a "wonder pop" which was less than wondermenting. Possibly wonderful. That basically all I wanted to say about that. Hm. I feel like... I've done something horribly wrong... I just have that feeling, but I don't know what is causing it. I'm sorry for being so apologetic. I did it again, gah. Recently, I've been apologizing for every little thing I do, and I don't know why. This might have something to do with the thinking I did something wrong, but I don't know. On a lighter note (I went from a light note, to a somewhat heavier one, back to a light one) um... I don't actually have anything to say. Jumping to conclusions Made me fall away from you. I'm so glad that the truth, has brought back together me and you We're sitting on the ground (sitting on the ground) And we whisper, (and we whisper) "Say what you're thinking out loud." Last song you heard: This one that is playing now, assuming you didn't mute it. Last thing you had to drink: Milk. Last time you showered: This morning. Last thing you ate: Lunch. Do You ... Smoke: Nope. Do drugs: Uh uh. Have sex: Not anymore... That implies that I used to. ooOOoohh. Not that good. Sleep with stuffed animals: Sometimes. Live in the moment: I am so not spontaneous. Have a boyfriend/girlfriend: The best. Have a dream that keeps coming back: That one with the car. Play an instrument: Nope. Believe there is life on other planets: I believe that with the universe so large and the possibility of millions of other Earth-like planets, that on one of them there has to be life... somewhere. Remember your first love: I do Still love him/her: I do not. Read the newspaper: Sometimes Have any gay or lesbian friends: Hmm... Does Hoi count as my friend? Just kidding... Believe in miracles: Not really. Just do it. Believe it's possible to remain faithful forever: Faithful like to a girl or like to a religion? Consider yourself tolerant of others: Ehh... There are more tolerant people than me. Consider love a mistake: Do I? I don't understand how that would be possible. Like the taste of alcohol: Not especially but it's not horribly terrible. Have a favorite candy: Candy... I don't know. I don't eat the stuff much. Believe in astrology: Not really, I read my horoscope from time to time though. :Believe in God: I believe with the world how it is, there must be a higher power guiding it. Pray: Not like every day, but from time to time I do. Go to church: I do. Have any secrets: Kevin, the point in keeping something a secret is that it doesn't get in the wrong hands. That's why you don't tell people... I have a few secrets that only like not that many people know about... What Melody calls my "secret Mafia life." Have any pets: I used to. My caty was soo cool Do well in school: TERRIBLE, I hate it. Go to or plan to go to college: Hopefully. Have a major: I am terribly indecisive. Talk to strangers who instant message you: Kevin that is so obviously an automated message, seeing that I have gotten the exact same thing like 10 times. Or maybe they just like me more, because I am cooler than you. I talk to strangers when they message me yes. Wear hats: Not often. My Oakley hat, that's so funny. Have any piercings: No. Have any tattoos: Ew, no. Hate yourself: At times. Have an obsession: Isn't it obvious? Have a secret crush: Shh, don't tell... Not really. Do they know yet: If I had said yes to the previous question, I would say "Well then it wouldn't be very secret would it?" but since I said no, this is pretty irrelevant. Collect anything: Girls, not really though. Have a best friend: I'm not the kind of person to rank one friend over another. But I have to say that some friends are better than others. Wish on stars: Don't wish, just make it happen yourself. Like your handwriting: It's exciting. Have any bad habits: I don't think that is considered a bad habit Kevin. That is considered being a guy. Care about looks: Hm. I want to say no, but you know that's a lie. Boy/girlfriend's looks: Wait, was the previous question like the looks of like random people? I don't get it. Friends and other people: Yeah all my friends have to be so hot. XP. Believe in witches: No Believe in Satan: Hmm... maybe... Believe in ghosts: Well in all my dying dreams, I can still see what happens to me after, so I would say yes. No one comes to my funeral... It's so empty. It's like no one likes me.

"Yi Si Lan Bao (Istanbul)" ~ Jay Chou chu zai yi si tan bao que zhi xiang ni he han bao wo xiang yao ni de wei xiao mei tian dou neng kan dao wo zhi dao zhe li hen mei dan jia xiang de ni geng mei *** I'm in Istanbul, But all I can think about is you and the burgers(???) I want to be able to see your smiles everyday I know it's beautiful here, but you, at home, are more breathtaking. 3. "Nuo Fu (Coward)" ~ Jay Chou shuo bu bu dai biao nuo fu ni ying gai hen jiao ao *** Saying no doesn't mean you're a coward, you should be very proud. 4. "Pu Tong Peng You (Just Friends)" ~ David Tao deng dai wo sui shi sui di zai deng dai zuo ni gan qing shang de yi lai wo mei you ren he de yi wen jiu shi ai *** I'll wait, However long or far, I'll wait I'll make it depend on how you feel I don't have any objections Only love. 5. "Ta De Jie Mao (Her eyelashes)" ~ Jay Chou qin ai de zong xie shi shi mei ban fa jiao biao cuo qing de gan jue you yi dian zao lai zhe bu zou hui rang ren hen gan mao yi shang zhe dao li wo quan dou liao *** My dear, some things can never be taught. Coming on to the wrong person is pretty bad Insisting on staying can make you get sick. I understand all of the above. 6. "An Jing (Silence)" ~ Jay Chou Ni yi jin yuan yuan li kai Wo ye hui man man zou kai Wei she me wo lian fen kai dou qian jiu zhe ni Wo zhen de mei you tian fen An jing de mei zhe me kuai Wo hui xue zhe fang qi ni Shi ying wei wo tai ai ni *** I was going to be annoying and put a fake traslation, but then I realized how stupid and pointless that would be, anyway, here it is. You are already so far away I'll slowly leave too Why is it that even as we break up, you still have power over me? I really can't do it Staying quiet is too hard I'll learn to let you go Because I love you too much Ok here is the fake translation I was going to put, I don't even know why: So All My Codes Only Have Evil Numbers If Someone Thinks Hard, Even Evil Numbers Express Many Yearns That was exciting, now on with the songs. 7. "Gong Bao Ji Ding (Kung Pao Chicken)" ~ David Tao Wo zhi xi wang mei tian gen ni zai yi qi Bu yong zuo she me, zai jia li jiu ke yi Oh..baby I dont know wei she me kan shang wo Mei you qian qu song ni "Hello Kitty" Ke yi, wo suo you de yi qie tong tong dou gei ni Ying wei wo ai ni *** I just want to be able to be with you every day We don't have to do anything, staying at home is fine Oh Baby, I don't know why you see me I don't have enough money to give you "Hello Kitty" Ok, I would easily give you everything that I have Because I love you 8. "Mi Lan De Xiao Tie Jiang (Milan's Little Blacksmith)" ~ Jay Chou Ta zhen de zhen de xiang zhi dao (Na shou lai zi dong ou de min yao he xian dao di shen me tiao) Mi lan de tian kong gang po xiao (Na ma di tie hai yao qiao duo shao ji ta cai neng mai de dao) Ta zhen de zhen de xiang zhi dao (Ta bu zhi dao, zen me ban cai hao, shui bu zhao) Ta jiang na pu man da po liao (Xiao xiao yuan wang jiu kuai shi xian le ta zai xiao) *** He really really wants to know (That folk song from Eastern Europe, in what key is that tune?) I just realized that a fun way to make people actually listen to you is to add "not that anyone cares" to the end of your ramblings as long as you aren't talking about like poop-shoveling or something. Yeah so I was talking to Ken Zhao the other night, and he made me realize a lot of things about things. Being really vague is also helpful. Houston is 10 games over .500, awesome pwnage! Something that makes people drone you out is when you are overly excited about something that is pretty unimportant. Another thing that does that is when you talk about what people listen to and what they don't. I often find myself asking the question, "When was the last time I actually listened, not physically, but like through any form of communication, to something important that [a person] had to say?" And then I try to think of what they were talking about and what not, and sometimes it is difficult. And then I ask the opposite, "When was the last time I have told [this person] something important?" I would have to say never for most people. I don't say because you don't care. See I did it again. For them I do call But my tears, they do not come. When will it return? Yeah so apparently, I can't fake cry anymore. I don't know whether that is a good thing or a bad thing.

But, soft! What light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun! Arise fair sun and kill the envious moon, Who is already sick and pale with grief That thou her maid are more fair than she. Be not her maid, since she is envious. Her vestal livery is but sick and green, And none but fools do wear it. Cast it off. It is my lady, oh, it is my love! Oh, that she knew she were! She speaks, yet she says nothing. What of that? Her eye discourses, I will answer it. I am too bold, 'tis not to me she speaks. Two of the fairest stars in all the heaven, Having some business do entreat her eyes To twinkle in their spheres till they return. What if her eyes were there, they in her head? The brightness of her cheek would shame those stars As daylight doth a lamp; her eyes in heaven Would through the airy region stream so bright That birds would sing and think it were not night. See how she leans her cheek upon her hand! Oh that I might be a glove upon that hand, That I might touch that cheek!

Ha, I just remembered the funniest experience of my life, I'm going to be laughing for days on end... Yeah. Good Story. I agree.

Shanghai is pretty cool so far. I demonstrated my immense logic skills before and during the plane ride there. OK so since my plane was leaving at 7:30 in the morning and I would have had to get before 5 anyway, I seriously contemplated not sleeping that night, but then I did for maybe like 2 hours which just made me groggy. Then I couldn't really sleep on the plane so I just watched the movies/in-flight entertainment, thinking that I would just sleep when I get to China. But then I realized with about like an hour left in the flight that the plane was landing at about 3 o'clock in the afternoon and it would be like at least 6 hours until sleepytime. By that time my eyes hurt because I hadn't been sleeping, and I couldn't sleep because my eyes hurt. It was a vicious cycle. Except that that didn't really happen. On the plane I watched four movies. I forget what the first one was because I didn't really watch it, but the other three were "Welcome to Mooseport", "Star Runner", and "Big Fish". "Big Fish" was ok. "Star Runner" was really good though. I never thought I would like an action movie this much. Especially a chinese action movie which is about kickboxing and whose main character is named "Bond" and is played by Vanness Wu. But anyway, Bond is a kickboxer who's entering the "Star Runner" competition, which is a fighting competition where the fighters can use any style they want. He realizes after being kicked out of his kickboxing school after mouthing off then losing to a guy named Chris that he needs to work hard if he is going to stand a chance against a Thai guy from New Zealand named Tank. Bond decides to learn Kung Fu to help beat Tank. It gets exciting after that. A side plot is woven in that involves Bond's Korean teacher who is this guy named Simon's mistress. She and Bond fall in love, but she goes back to Korea with Simon when he divorces his wife. Bond also has a grandfather who is dying. Go urlLink Here In China I have been watching the equivalents of MTV and ESPN on TV. The Sports channel is like only covering the European Championship and Wimbledon. The music channel is like completely taken over by Jay Chou it's amazing. I was watching the top ten countdown thingy and 3 of them were sung by Jay and 4 others were written by him. I went to the store to try to find the Star Runner DVD but I couldn't. I was in there for possibly half an hour and I heard them play 5 Jay songs. "Ye Ye Pao de Cha", "Fan Fang Xiang de Zhong", "Wan Mei Zhu Yi", "Hui Dao Guo Qu", and "Yi Di An de Lao Bao Jiu". While I was in the store I realized something. Shanghai girls that look like they might be my age are actually like 30. Also chinese guys are really short. Except for the mutant ones that are humongous. There isn't any middle ground. For fun I went on this scale in the store that told you how tall you were, how much you weighed and your build. I'm 176.5 cm tall, and weigh 50 kg and am underweight by 21 kg. Jeez that like me and a half. But that's to be expected. I was also wearing shoes. Chinese scales always have that build thingy, even home ones. At my grandparents' house I was weighing myself, and there are levels for the build that are basically like "Super Skinny", "Very Skinny", "Skinny", "Normal", "Fat", Very Fat", "Super Fat" with an arrow that you set to your height. When I went on, the arrow didn't even go into "Super Skinny" I found that kind of funny. It's raining. Dvds here cost less than 20 RMB. That's about 2 dollars. If I go through customs with like 20 DVDs, do I need to declare them, since I only would hypothetically have paid like 40 dollars total for them. Hmm... They also put their adult section right next their kid's section. If you know what I mean by adult section. Food is good. Going to get fat here. Grammar worsening. That's too bad. k thx.

And this was like right after I read that part of the "Duan Le De Xian" lyrics that go: Ni lei shui wang xia de diao Shuo hui ji zhu wo de hao Wo ye wan qi le zui jiao xiao Which means: Your teardrops stream down You say that you'll remember me I then curled up the corners of my mouth and smiled. I'll be taking about maybe a one-week break from the internet now.
